intro: Erythrococca aculeata, commonly known as the prickly erythrococca, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its hairy, woody stems and lobed leaves. The plant produces small, pale yellow flowers that are clustered in spherical inflorescences. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release numerous small, smooth seeds. Erythrococca aculeata is often found in disturbed habitats and is adapted to thrive in dry, sandy soils.
